metadata.title: CVE-2024-27436 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:usb-audio: Stop parsing channels bits when all channels are found. If a usbaudio device sets more bits than the amount of channels it could writeoutside of the map array.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-260-generic - 4.4.0-260.294
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-260-generic - 4.4.0-260.294
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-260-lowlatency - 4.4.0-260.294
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
